data.title: Scientologist Celeb Snaring Skillz
data.text:
So it works like a cult? This shit is so creepy.

Also, OT, how the fuck do you get presale codes for Bey tickets? Plz help?

This. As the first comment. I can't.

ikr I ruined the whole post so awful omg what will we ever do with ourselves lawd someone please get you some smelling salts.

(no subject) - chismosa Expand

Idk if this is it, but hope this can help?

http://www.beyonce.com/vip

you need to sign up on her blog (it's free) and i'm pretty sure the presale password is mrscarter2013. when your date goes on sale you have to go to the tour section of her site and click the "buy" link next to the date/venue listed. you can't do it directly on her ticketmaster page as far as i know. it's pretty fucking stupid because her site crashes right when they go on sale.

(no subject) - zharia Expand

This is the second time I've seen the word "precedent" used on here. When did this place become Law & Order: Livejournal?

lmao

Law & OhNoTheyDidnt has a better ring.

It worked

lol

dun dun

is that word supposed to be uncommon or something...?

Right, is this gonna be a thing now?

Hello, you called?

lol, best comment + username ever

Sup Lenny?

(no subject) - tine_marie Expand

omg lenny, my father <3

ohmygod you exist?!

RIP LENNY I LOVE YOU

(no subject) - hpxstac Expand

lol mte

Slowly. Covertly. Mostly it was started by the guys in the black hawk helicopters and then adapted by those in the music industry and they put the idea into subliminal messages in the music.

(no subject) - buncha_cruncha Expand

(no subject) - waterlanding Expand

(no subject) - francesbcobain Expand

lol mte

ok so everything is bolded...

It's a good read sorry~~

dammit i was just about to go to bed

That was actually really interesting, Scientology is so scary D:

When it's explained like this, you can see why so many celebrities get drawn in to it. The security and privacy must be appealing to them. It's all batshit of course, but it's more understandable.

my bf has an uncle that tried to leave scientology and they locked him in a room and i'm pretty sure he had no place to go to the bathroom, i'm not sure how long it was for though (i heard this a long time ago). bitches are frightening.

Did the uncle get out?

not right after that, but he might have since then.

idk if it's in this article but she was on the view saying how they treat the kids as though they're a shell, so they don't treat them like children

which made me think of suri & her heels/disturbing adult-like clothing

nah i think suri herself just wanted to wear heels.

i mean if everyone around you is walking around in them, maybe she was like Yeah I want those shoes. and she got it.

idk i always saw her as like an infant adult & it disturbed me to my CORE

now after the divorce she dresses like a normal kid her age

(no subject) - fwee_prower Expand

(no subject) - beetlebums Expand

(no subject) - numbedtoe Expand

I really want to read this book.

seriously i am still freaking the fuck out after that Deadly persuations episode about Sea Org on ID

omw is this online anywhere? i want to watch it

i dunno. netflix might have it.

u can watch it here:

http://www.sockshare.com/file/A94E5E74A971687F#

Ooh Scientology, whenever these posts pop up late at night, I can't go to bed.. far too good to pass up

i have a feeling i'll be looking up wiki articles all night about this

They will suck you in because those articles will lead you to documentary videos and than testimonials from people who escaped and you'll realize that these fuckers are fucked up to infinity and beyond

I still haven't started Going Clear: Scientology, Hollywood, and the Prison of Belief. It has been on my Nook for a couple weeks now. I suppose I'll be reading both next week.

ugh I got addicted to Scientology docs for a while. Not a good phase. Netflix is my downfall.

Sometimes last year, I stayed up watching Scientology docs on Youtube with my best friend over GChat (we were too lazy to log in to Skype), and it was so eye-opening. We obviously already knew they were beyond shady. But it was terribly different listening to people who were able to escape speak about their experiences.

I also recommend Janet Reitman's book "Inside Scientology" if you haven't read it already. I just can't get enough of these crazies.

(no subject) - astrofisica Expand

lol I'm in the Scientology tag rn because of that book. In case you haven't started it, do it. It's fucking crazy.

I want to read this book! Scientology is interesting, and so so cray.

Can we talk about this sentence?

As Dallas explained, the celebrities who would come to the center were very human there.

Just that sentence? They're all atrocious. It's like rereading this book on Mary Seacole (that I still need to sum up for a paper thing tomorrow). I wish we could talk about my professors issues with writing a review of text that is seems to be written for a third grader.

Edited at 2013-02-12 07:02 am (UTC)

usually they're very alien duh

mte

i want to believe

lol i THINK they mean they just acted ~normal~~~~ but it is scientology and they believe in xenu SO IDK

(no subject) - wonderwomanhero

(no subject) - (Anonymous)

Ugh that movie. Nightmares for days.

is this the best excerpt they could get?

It is paragraph after paragraph of "normal people got treated differently unlike celebrities". Yeah? no shit. Even non-Scientology celebs get treated better than the average person. Thanks for that insight Dallas.

Because Nicole’s father was in the psychology field, this made perfect sense. We were taught that those in the mental health field were bad and evil. We believed what L. Ron Hubbard had written about them was true, that they were the reason behind people like Adolf Hitler and everything else bad that had ever happened on the “whole track,” the whole record in our minds of things that had happened to us over trillions of years.

Damn Hitler if only you didn't go in for that one therapy session you could have been so different. Was the psychiatrist jewish? did he get annoyed that they answer questions with questions? this is all starting to make sense. thanks L. Ron.

People always wonder why celebs would be in a church that treats people badly tho, so stuff like this explains that - like in pretty much every other area of life - the celebs don't get the same treatment as most.

celebs don't really care if others don't get treated as they do as long as they get treated better.

(no subject) - bittermunchkin Expand
